p: Mangifera indica is a common tree in the home gardens of villages. Our informants described the use of the ripe mango peel to treat various gastrointestinal disorders (FL 100%). The use of this species for this category disease is confirmed by other studies on the folk medicine of Nepal [ 40], but bark and roots are generally the portions to which the greatest curative efficacy is attributed [ 23, 46]. Therefore, the medicinal use of the fruit peel is typical of the survey area.
